intro: Peucedanum ecklonianum, commonly known as the African cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Peucedanum ecklonianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
